info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:06AM EDT until May 14 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of northwest and western Virginia, including the following counties, in northwest Virginia, City of Winchester, Clarke, Frederick, Page, Shenandoah and Warren. In western Virginia, City of Harrisonburg and Rockingham.
* WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 206 AM EDT, stream gauges indicated water levels remained steady or in some cases were still rising on medium stem rivers. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area due to rain that fell yesterday evening. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harrisonburg... Winchester... Front Royal... Strasburg... Woodstock... Millwood Pike... Berryville... Timberville... Mount Jackson... Stephens City... Star Tannery... Weyers Cave... New Market... Middletown... Edinburg... Maurertown... Boyce... Toms Brook... Dilbeck... Seven Fountains... - This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Senseny Rd between Triple J Rd and Salem Church Rd, Carpers Valley Road at Buffalo Lick Run, Valley Mill Road near Abrams Creek, Senseny Road at Abrams Creek near Mead Drive, Lowry Drive near Hollingsworth Drive, Huttle Road near Ridings Mill Road, Fromans Road near Cedar Creek, Northwestern Pike at Back Mountain Road, Wren Lane and Oranda Road, Fort Valley Road at Passage Creek, Route 55 near Passage Creek, Mountain Road near Passage Creek, 8th Street at Stadium Drive in Front Royal, Happy Creek Road at Happy Creek, Ritenour Hollow Road at Reliance Road and Howellsville Road at Farms River Road. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Clarke, VA; Frederick, VA; Page, VA; Rockingham, VA; Shenandoah, VA; Warren, VA; City of Harrisonburg, VA; City of Winchester, VA
